data.title: What is a Confusion Matrix in Machine Learning
data.description: Make the Confusion Matrix Less Confusing. A confusion matrix is a technique for summarizing the performance of a classification algorithm. Classification accuracy alone can be misleading if you have an unequal number of observations in each class or if you have more than two classes in your dataset. Calculating a confusion matrix can give you […]

data.title: Reinforcement learning with unsupervised auxiliary tasks
data.description: Our primary mission at DeepMind is to push the boundaries of AI, developing programs that can learn to solve any complex problem without needing to be taught how. Our reinforcement learning agents have achieved breakthroughs in Atari 2600 games and the game of Go. Such systems, however, can require a lot of data and a long time to learn so we are always looking for ways to improve our generic learning algorithms.

data.title: How to Implement Random Forest From Scratch in Python
data.description: Decision trees can suffer from high variance which makes their results fragile to the specific training data used.
